Grouped_Utterances: I think I want to explore how I can balance my PhD work with wedding planning after the wedding.

Hi, Ellie! It’s been pretty hectic but good. The wedding is just around the corner. I’m feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. I want everything to go smoothly, but I know I can’t control everything. It’s been great. I’ve been writing about my feelings leading up to the wedding and reflecting on my experiences in the PhD program.
He’s really excited too! We’ve been working together on the planning, which has been nice.

I think I’m realizing that my anxiety often comes from wanting to please everyone, and that’s not realistic. I feel more confident. It’s nice to know we’re on the same page. It feels relieving. I think having a plan will help me feel less scattered. No, I think I’m good for today. I feel more prepared and focused.
Yes, I’ve been using the breathing exercises and journaling a lot. It really helps me stay calm.

I think I need to keep reminding myself that it’s my day, and I should enjoy it. I also want to take moments to step back and breathe. I want to take a few moments alone with my partner to soak it all in. I think that will help. We have! We talked about staying united and focusing on each other, no matter what happens with family. I think I need to set clear boundaries for my time. I don’t want to let one overshadow the other. I could create a weekly schedule where I allocate time for PhD work and wedding-related tasks, so I’m not overwhelmed. Sure! I think I’d like to dedicate certain days to focus on my PhD readings and assignments, and then have specific days for wedding tasks.
